1.title: United Negro College Fund
1.subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

1.title: Sugarfoots
1.subtitle: Sugarfoots anchor product is a renowned child-safe, hand-crafted multi-ethnic rag doll, complemented by a children’s book series based on folktales from cultures around the world. Our mission is sustained by a performing arts summer camp for youth that sets the pace among competitors, inspiriting the imagination through creative storytelling, song and dance.

products.name: Cinnamon
products.description: One of Sugarfoots' signature rag dolls. Colors and fabrics will vary with handcrafted items.

products.name: Boy Dolls
products.description: One of Sugarfoots' signature rag dolls. Colors and fabrics will vary with handcrafted items.

products.name: Black Lives Matter Sugarfoots Bistro 16oz Mugs
products.description: What better way to show solidarity with Cocoa, Ginger and Cinnamon Black Lives Matter Sugarfoots Bistro Mugs!

2.title: Vera Institute of Justice
2.subtitle: Vera is powered by hundreds of advocates, researchers, and activists working to transform the criminal legal and immigration systems until they’re fair for all. Founded in 1961 to advocate for alternatives to money bail in New York City, Vera is now a national organization that partners with impacted communities and government leaders for change.

2.title: African-American Heroism in the Military
2.subtitle: Dating all the way back to the American Revolution, African-Americans have played key roles in the history (and success) of the U.S. military. Profiled below are some notable African-Americans and their achievements, as well as milestones in the integration of African-Americans in the U.S. military.

3.title: 210 Teas
3.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

3.title: Robert Tanner Freeman - Bytes of History
3.subtitle: Robert Tanner Freeman was born in Washington DC in 1846. He was the son of slaves who had bought their freedom in the 19th century. Historical records are unclear but they probably adopted the surname Freeman in response to their transition.

4.title: Why Seeing Yourself Represented on Screen Is So Important
4.subtitle: "Black Panther" has been hailed as a model success story for depicting diversity on screen. According to past research, the representation of minority groups in mass media has a powerful educational impact on audiences.

4.title: Mike D's BBQ
4.subtitle: Mike D's BBQ is an award winning line of signature BBQ sauces and all-purpose dry rubs. Our sauces are a twist on the traditional BBQ sauce with some unique seasonings and spice levels.

products.name: BIG Sauce Set
products.description: Mike D's BIG Sauce is our twist on a traditional BBQ Sauce. It has the perfect blend of smoky and sweet just like our rub. There is a small hint of heat to balance the flavors, but it is a very mild sauce overall.

products.name: Rub Master Set
products.description: Are you a master with the dry rub? This set allows you to use both award winning rubs on large and small meals like the master you are! This set contains one of each large rub (10.24 ounces)!

products.name: Throw Some D's On It T-Shirt
products.description: Rep your favorite BBQ brand and let everyone know they need to "Throw Some D's On It"

6.title: Seeing White Podcast Series
6.subtitle: Just what is going on with white people? Police shootings of unarmed African Americans. Acts of domestic terrorism by white supremacists. The renewed embrace of raw, undisguised white-identity politics. Unending racial inequity in schools, housing, criminal justice, and hiring. Some of this feels new, but in truth it’s an old story.

7.title: The Pan-African Congresses, 1900-1945
7.subtitle: In the nearly half century between 1900 and 1945, various political leaders and intellectuals from Europe, North America, and Africa met six times to discuss colonial control of Africa and develop strategies for eventual African political liberation.

7.title: How colorism shapes our standards of beauty
7.subtitle: When Chika Okoro read the casting call for one of her favorite films, she noticed that actresses with darker skin were assigned lesser roles — prompting her to address a phenomenon she'd experienced all her life: colorism. In this eye-opening talk, Okoro shares coping strategies along with steps that could help eliminate this insidious and destructive mindset of discrimination.

8.title: Why Many Americans Can’t See The Wealth Gap Between White And Black America
8.subtitle: In the last year and a quarter, the pandemic has served as a stark reminder of just how unequal America still is. But it also hasn’t been a “reminder” for everyone. Black Americans and other Americans of color didn’t have the luxury of forgetting that American society is unequal.

8.title: The Afro Gypsy
8.subtitle: I create jewelry and accessories that enhance the uniqueness of you; we like to call it Bohemian with an AFRO-tude! My work predominantly consist of leather and metalwork items. But, considering my love for the extraordinary, you may stumble upon many other new or vintage items that could steal your heart!

9.title: What it takes to be racially literate
9.subtitle: Over the last year, Priya Vulchi and Winona Guo traveled to all 50 US states, collecting personal stories about race and intersectionality. Now they're on a mission to equip every American with the tools to understand, navigate and improve a world structured by racial division.

10.title: "I Have A Dream" Speech, In Its Entirety
10.subtitle: Listen to Martin Luther King, Jr.'s "I Have a Dream" speech.

10.title: Big Mama's Sauce
10.subtitle: We believe that to be the best we must use only the best ingredients. This homemade recipe has been the highlight of our family gatherings since at least 2002…honestly Big Mama can’t even remember, that’s how long she been making it! Big Mama never liked store bought sauce and she wanted to serve only the best to her loved ones. So here we are…on the store shelf ironically! Lol…We hope you taste only love and enjoy just as our family has for all of these years!

11.title: The symbols of systemic racism — and how to take away their power
11.subtitle: Multidisciplinary artist and TED Fellow Paul Rucker is unstitching the legacy of systemic racism in the United States. A collector of artifacts connected to the history of slavery — from branding irons and shackles to postcards depicting lynchings — Rucker couldn't find an undamaged Ku Klux Klan robe for his collection, so he began making his own.

11.title: Liberation Library
11.subtitle: Young people in the jails and prisons we serve are experiencing a loss of programming and in-person family visits, leading to further isolation during these uncertain times. We believe it is now more important than ever for incarcerated young people to have access to other worlds of their choosing.

12.title: The Other Wes Moore
12.subtitle: Two kids named Wes Moore were born blocks apart within a year of each other. Both grew up fatherless in similar Baltimore neighborhoods and had difficult childhoods; both hung out on street corners with their crews; both ran into trouble with the police. How, then, did one grow up to be a Rhodes Scholar, decorated veteran, White House Fellow, and business leader, while the other ended up a convicted murderer serving a life sentence?

12.title: Smell Good Spa
12.subtitle: Established in 1998, we are purveyors of aromatic products for women who are making a conscientious change in their personal care products. Our products are the cherry-on-top for women who love to live good, feel good and smell good, wholesomely.

Since bail money comes back to us when cases close, we're able to recycle every dollar donated at least twice per year.

15.title: Stay Informed: Ma'Khia Bryant Shooting
15.subtitle: A teenage girl who the police say threatened two girls with a knife was fatally shot by an officer in Columbus, Ohio, on Tuesday, April 20th, 2021, shortly before a jury reached a guilty verdict in the murder trial of the former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin in last year’s killing of George Floyd.

15.title: 3 ways to speak English
15.subtitle: Jamila Lyiscott is a "tri-tongued orator" in her powerful spoken-word essay "Broken English," she celebrates — and challenges — the three distinct flavors of English she speaks with her friends, in the classroom and with her parents. As she explores the complicated history and present-day identity that each language represents, she unpacks what it means to be "articulate."

16.subtitle: Cellphone video of the incident shows police officers in Kenosha, Wisconsin shooting a Black man multiple times on August 23 as he tried to get into a vehicle. Read more about the incident and the protests that followed here.

18.subtitle: The Sentencing Project promotes effective and humane responses to crime that minimize imprisonment and criminalization of youth and adults by promoting racial, ethnic, economic, and gender justice.

18.title: Beyond the Numbers: The Experiential Effects of Stereotype Threat on Students of Color at TCU
18.subtitle: This study aims to examine if and how the effects of negative stereotypes of students of color are felt beyond the statistical measures of academic success, reaching into the classroom and social experiences of these students.

21.title: Tell Congress to Support the MORE Act (H.R. 3884/S. 2227)
21.subtitle: We believe in cannabis legalization, but only if it’s got justice baked right in. Even with more and more states saying yes to legal cannabis, hundreds of thousands of people are still being arrested every year, most of them for possession—and they are disproportionately Black. It doesn’t have to be that way. With your help we can legalize cannabis while expunging prior cannabis convictions, and make 4/20 a day we all can celebrate.

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Gala Edition

As a treat, she holds a special key as your invitation to unlock the magic of her kingdom.

products.name: Princess Omalie, The Coronation And The Polka Dot Lamb
products.description: Princess Omalie of the African kingdom of IgboOrai could be the happiest girl on the planet — except that her family has been under a curse. Unless the curse of the Goliath beetle necklace is lifted, Omalie’s father might die in a horrible freak accident. He might never be crowned king. Omalie worries about her family, and about her own safety; how will she ever lead a peaceful happy life, have friends, and go to school?

26.title: All Hip-Hop
26.subtitle:
AllHipHop.com was founded and launched in 1998 by CEO’s "Grouchy" Greg Watkins and Chuck "Jigsaw" Creekmur.

After many years of developing the site, AllHipHop.com has become a valuable resource for hip-hop on the internet, featuring daily news, interviews, reviews, multimedia, a fast growing community and other interesting content.

Publications such as CNN, The Source, XXL, Complex, New York Post, The New York Times and many others cite AllHipHop.com’s news and features due to our accuracy and trustworthiness.

28.title: John Hope - Biography
28.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

29.title: Colorism in the Beauty Industry
29.subtitle: America has progressed tremendously over recent years in terms of racial inequality, but colorism remains to be seen on a global scale.

29.title: Microaggressions Matter
29.subtitle: They may not always be ill-intentioned, but the slights illuminate deeper problems in America.

30.title: How to Be an Antiracist
30.subtitle: Ibram X. Kendi's concept of antiracism reenergizes and reshapes the conversation about racial justice in America—but even more fundamentally, points us toward liberating new ways of thinking about ourselves and each other.

30.title: Official Black Wall Street
30.subtitle: Get thousands of Black-owned businesses at your fingertips with the largest online platform for Black businesses.

31.title: Sports Can Battle Racism Workshop
31.subtitle: A workshop for coaches on how to ensure that sports is an inclusive environment for ALL athletes.
31.moreInfo: In this 90 minute workshop, coaches will have an interactive discussion on how to combat racial discrimination, champion moral courage and empower their programs to create positive change in their communities.

31.title: Eb + Flo Boutique
31.subtitle: Eb and Flo started out as just a vision and manifested in 2020. Our CEO, Ebony Hunter, is a strong believer in living out your dreams while not only looking good but feeling good too. Our mission is to provide styles that flow with you from moment to moment, whether you’re making a quick run to the grocery store or meeting the girls for brunch. With comfort and quality in mind, we make looking lavish easy. Look good, feel good.

products.name: Classic Boss Lady Track Suit
products.description: Chic track suit for the lady on the go. Throw it on for a quick trip to the grocery store, a nail appointment, or dress it up for a cute brunch look.

products.name: Tedy Soft Sherpa Jacket
products.description: The warmest and most comfortable jacket you'll ever own! The Teddy Sherpa Jacket feels like a warm hug or like you're wearing a blanket. Features a drawstring hem that allows you to snatch that waist hunny *snap*snap*

products.name: "Thou shall not try me" T-Shirt
products.description: Mood 24:7! Let the folks know the deal in this super soft tee.
